    • Constructor Detail

      • YRCFileHelper

        public YRCFileHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • getAllowedTypes

        public static java.lang.String[] getAllowedTypes(java.lang.String backendTableName)
        This method returns the permissible file types for file upload.The type of files allowed can be set to a specific back end table or can be global or can be application specific. The global or back end table specific properties can be set in yfs.properties. Application specific properties can be set using YRCFileHelper.setAllowedTypes. If the properties are not set, then default type of file allowed are *.txt, *.pdf and *.doc files
        Parameters:
        backendTableName - is the parent table of the File Attachment.
        Returns:
        allowed file types

      • setAllowedTypes

        public static void setAllowedTypes(java.lang.String[] allowedTypes)
        Utility method to set Application specific, allowed file types for file upload.This should be subset of the type of files allowed for upload which is set in yfs.properties file for property sc.file.upload.allowedtypes
        Parameters:
        allowedTypes - is string array of type of files allowed for file upload

      • getMaxAllowedSize

        public static long getMaxAllowedSize(java.lang.String tableName)
        This method returns the permissible size of the file for file upload.The maximum size of file allowed can be set to a specific back end table or can be global or can be application specific. The global or back end table specific properties can be set in yfs.properties Application specific properties can be set using YRCFileHelper.setMaxAllowedSize. If the properties are not set, then default maximum size of the file allowed is 10MB
        Parameters:
        tableName - is the parent table of the File Attachment.
        Returns:
        maximum size of the file allowed for file upload

      • setMaxAllowedSize

        public static void setMaxAllowedSize(long maxAllowedSize)
        Utility method to set Application specific, maximum size of the file allowed for file upload.
        Parameters:
        maxAllowedSize - is maximum allowed size for file upload

      • validate

        public static YRCValidationResponse validate(YRCTextBindingData data,
                                             java.lang.String fileLocation)
        Utility method to validate the file being uploaded.
        Parameters:
        data - is the binding data of the text control from which back end table info is obtained, if any is set
        fileLocation - is the location of the file which has to be validated
        Returns:
        an instance of YRCValidationResponse with status code to indicate if the validation is successful or is a failure
        See Also:
        YRCValidationResponse, YRCTextBindingData

      • validate

        public static YRCValidationResponse validate(YRCTblClmBindingData data,
                                             java.lang.String fileLocation)
        Utility method to validate the file being uploaded.
        Parameters:
        data - is the binding data of the table column from which back end table info is obtained, if any is set
        fileLocation - is the location of the file which has to be validated
        Returns:
        an instance of YRCValidationResponse with status code to indicate if the validation is successful or is a failure
        See Also:
        YRCValidationResponse, YRCTblClmBindingData

      • getValidator

        public static YRCBaseFileValidator getValidator()
        Utility method to get additional file validator set
        Returns:
        instance of YRCBaseFileValidator set for additional validation

      • setValidator

        public static void setValidator(YRCBaseFileValidator validator)
        Utility method to set additional file validator , which will be invoked if the basic validation is successful
        Parameters:
        validator - is instance of YRCBaseFileValidator set for additional validation

      • getFileUploadDialog

        public static java.lang.String getFileUploadDialog(java.lang.String backendTableName)
        Utility method to get a file Upload dialog to choose a file to upload.
        Parameters:
        backendTableName - is the table name of the parent table to which a file has to be attached. This table name information is required to determine the type of files allowed for upload are table specific.
        Returns:
        the location of the file selected from the dialog by the user

      • download

        public static void download(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control ctrl,
                            java.lang.String apiName,
                            org.w3c.dom.Document apiInput,
                            org.w3c.dom.Document fileDownloadInput,
                            IYRCDownloadHandler handler)
        Utility method to download file from the database.
        Parameters:
        ctrl - is the control listening to the events i.e, for download start/end/error
        apiName - is the Name of the API which should be call for download Authorization
        apiInput - is the input xml for API which has to be called for API authorization
        fileDownloadInput - is the input to download the file - <FileAttachment FileAttachmenKey="" FileName="" TableName="" TableKey="" ColonyId="" TableType=""> FileAttachmentKey is mandatory. TableType and ColonyId are required in special cases in case of MultiSchema
        handler - is an instance of fileDownloadInput to handle file download process

      • fireEvent

        public static void fireEvent(int eventType,
                             org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control ctrl,
                             YRCFileResponse fileResponse)
        This method is intended to be used by Platform to fire events during file upload download and during file delete
        Parameters:
        eventType - is the type of event to be fired
        ctrl - is the control listening to the events
        fileResponse - gives information about the status and error message if any

      • getAllowedFileTypesAsString

        public static java.lang.String getAllowedFileTypesAsString(java.lang.String tableName)
        Utility method to get the file types allowed as string
        Parameters:
        tableName - is the table for which allowed types properties have to returned as string
        Returns:
        allowed file types as string
